page.title: 04ALLESTREE:AGRICULTURE
page.content: BURLEY MEADOWS IS A FAMILY FARM RUN BY THE FOSTER FAMILY. IT IS A MIXED FARM OF 200 ACRES (80 HECTARES) LYING ON GENTLY SLOPING LAND OVERLOOKING THE DERWENT VALLEY. UNTIL RECENTLY THE MOST IMPORTANT BRANCH OF THE FARM'S ACTIVITIES WAS THE DAIRY HERD WHICH CONSISTED OF ABOUT 70 FRIESIANS,BUT THIS HAS NOW BEEN SOLD AND REPLACED BY A BEEF HERD,MOSTLY FRIESIANS,AND SHEEP WHOSE PURPOSE IS MAINLY TO BREED LAMBS FOR MEAT. ABOUT 90 ACRES IS DEVOTED TO WHEAT AND BARLEY AND A SMALL AREA TO POTATOES. A RECENT DEVELOPMENT IS INTO SOFT FRUIT:RASPBERRIES,STRAWBERRIES, BLACKCURRANTS AND GOOSEBERRIES.THESE COVER AROUND 15 ACRES AT PRESENT,BUT THE INTENTION IS TO EXPAND THIS SECTOR.MOST OF THE FRUIT IS SOLD ON A PICK-YOUR-OWN BASIS.
